verses.kjv: Woe to the rebellious children, saith the LORD, that take counsel, but not of me; and that cover with a covering, but not of my spirit, that they may add sin to sin:
verses.web: “Woe to the rebellious children”, says LORD, “who take counsel, but not from me; and who make an alliance, but not with my Spirit, that they may add sin to sin,
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for my rebellious children," says the LORD. "They make plans, but not with me. They form alliances, but not with my Spirit, piling sin on top of sin.

verses.kjv: That walk to go down into Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of Egypt!
verses.web: who set out to go down into Egypt, and have not asked my advice, to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to take refuge in the shadow of Egypt!
verses.ct: They head down to Egypt without asking for my guidance, looking to Pharaoh for protection and hiding in Egypt's shadow for safety.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the trust in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
verses.web: Therefore the strength of Pharaoh will be your shame, and the refuge in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
verses.ct: But Pharaoh's protection will only bring you shame, and Egypt's shadow will leave you humiliated.

verses.kjv: For his princes were at Zoan, and his ambassadors came to Hanes.
verses.web: For their princes are at Zoan, and their ambassadors have come to Hanes.
verses.ct: Their officials have already arrived in Zoan, and their ambassadors have reached Hanes.

verses.kjv: They were all ashamed of a people that could not profit them, nor be an help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.
verses.web: They shall all be ashamed because of a people that can’t profit them, that are not a help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.”
verses.ct: But everyone will be embarrassed by a nation that can't help them — a people who offer no aid, no benefit, only shame and disgrace."

verses.kjv: The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the bunches of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.
verses.web: The burden of the animals of the South. Through the land of trouble and anguish, of the lioness and the lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they carry their riches on the shoulders of young donkeys, and their treasures on the humps of camels, to an unprofitable people.
verses.ct: A message about the animals heading south: Through a land of hardship and danger — home to lions and lionesses, vipers and deadly flying serpents — they load their wealth onto the backs of young donkeys and their treasures onto the humps of camels, all for a nation that will do them no good.

verses.kjv: For the Egyptians shall help in vain, and to no purpose: therefore have I cried concerning this, Their strength is to sit still.
verses.web: For Egypt helps in vain, and to no purpose; therefore I have called her Rahab who sits still.
verses.ct: Egypt's help is completely worthless and pointless. That's why I call her "Rahab Who Sits Still" — all talk, no action.

verses.kjv: Now go, write it before them in a table, and note it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever:
verses.web: Now go, write it before them on a tablet, and inscribe it in a book, that it may be for the time to come forever and ever.
verses.ct: "Now go and write this down on a tablet in front of them. Record it in a book so it will stand as a permanent witness for all time.

verses.kjv: That this is a rebellious people, lying children, children that will not hear the law of the LORD:
verses.web: For it is a rebellious people, lying children, children who will not hear LORD’s law;
verses.ct: These are rebellious people, dishonest children — children who refuse to listen to the law of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Which say to the seers, See not; and to the prophets, Prophesy not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy deceits:
verses.web: who tell the seers, “Don’t see!” and the prophets, “Don’t prophesy to us right things. Tell us pleasant things. Prophesy deceits.
verses.ct: They tell the seers, "Stop seeing visions!" and the prophets, "Don't tell us what's true. Tell us what we want to hear. Give us pleasant illusions.

verses.kjv: Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.
verses.web: Get out of the way. Turn away from the path. Cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.”
verses.ct: Get out of our way! Leave the path! Stop shoving the Holy One of Israel in our faces."

verses.kjv: Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and stay thereon:
verses.web: Therefore the Holy One of Israel says, “Because you despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and rely on it,
verses.ct: So the Holy One of Israel says this: "Because you reject this message and instead put your trust in oppression and deceit, leaning on them for support,

verses.kjv: Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.
verses.web: therefore this iniquity shall be to you like a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking comes suddenly in an instant.
verses.ct: this sin will be like a crack bulging out in a high wall — it looks stable, but its collapse comes suddenly, in an instant.

verses.kjv: And he shall break it as the breaking of the potters’ vessel that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water withal out of the pit.
verses.web: He will break it as a potter’s vessel is broken, breaking it in pieces without sparing, so that there won’t be found among the broken pieces a piece good enough to take fire from the hearth, or to dip up water out of the cistern.”
verses.ct: It will shatter like a clay pot smashed to pieces without mercy — broken so completely that among the fragments you won't find a single piece big enough to scoop coals from a fireplace or dip water from a cistern."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
verses.web: For thus said the Lord LORD, the Holy One of Israel, “You will be saved in returning and rest. Your strength will be in quietness and in confidence.” You refused,
verses.ct: The Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel, told you: "If you come back to me and rest, you will be saved. Your strength will come through quietness and confidence." But you refused.

verses.kjv: But ye said, No; for we will flee upon horses; therefore shall ye flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.
verses.web: but you said, “No, for we will flee on horses;” therefore you will flee; and, “We will ride on the swift;” therefore those who pursue you will be swift.
verses.ct: Instead you said, "No! We'll escape on horses!" So escape you will — running for your lives. You said, "We'll ride fast horses!" But those chasing you will be even faster.

verses.kjv: One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one; at the rebuke of five shall ye flee: till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain, and as an ensign on an hill.
verses.web: One thousand will flee at the threat of one. At the threat of five, you will flee until you are left like a beacon on the top of a mountain, and like a banner on a hill.
verses.ct: A thousand of you will run from a single threat. When 5 enemies threaten, all of you will scatter — until you're left standing alone like a flagpole on a mountaintop, like a lonely banner on a hill.

verses.kjv: And therefore will the LORD wait, that he may be gracious unto you, and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have mercy upon you: for the LORD is a God of judgment: blessed are all they that wait for him.
verses.web: Therefore LORD will wait, that he may be gracious to you; and therefore he will be exalted, that he may have mercy on you, for LORD is a God of justice. Blessed are all those who wait for him.
verses.ct: Yet the LORD longs to be gracious to you. He rises to show you mercy, because the LORD is a God of justice. Blessed are all who wait for him.

verses.kjv: For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry; when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.
verses.web: For the people will dwell in Zion at Jerusalem. You will weep no more. He will surely be gracious to you at the voice of your cry. When he hears you, he will answer you.
verses.ct: People of Zion, who live in Jerusalem — you won't weep forever. The LORD will be gracious to you when you cry out to him. The moment he hears you, he will answer.

verses.kjv: And though the Lord give you the bread of adversity, and the water of affliction, yet shall not thy teachers be removed into a corner any more, but thine eyes shall see thy teachers:
verses.web: Though the Lord may give you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, yet your teachers won’t be hidden any more, but your eyes will see your teachers;
verses.ct: Even though the Lord may give you the bread of hardship and the water of suffering, your teachers won't be hidden from you anymore. You'll see them with your own eyes.

verses.kjv: And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.
verses.web: and when you turn to the right hand, and when you turn to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying, “This is the way. Walk in it.”
verses.ct: Whether you turn to the right or to the left, you'll hear a voice behind you saying, "This is the way. Walk in it."

verses.kjv: Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of silver, and the ornament of thy molten images of gold: thou shalt cast them away as a menstruous cloth; thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.
verses.web: You shall defile the overlaying of your engraved images of silver, and the plating of your molten images of gold. You shall cast them away as an unclean thing. You shall tell it, “Go away!”
verses.ct: Then you'll treat your silver-plated carved idols and your gold-covered metal images as something disgusting. You'll throw them away like filthy rags and say to them, "Get out of here!"

verses.kjv: Then shall he give the rain of thy seed, that thou shalt sow the ground withal; and bread of the increase of the earth, and it shall be fat and plenteous: in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.
verses.web: He will give the rain for your seed, with which you will sow the ground; and bread of the increase of the ground will be rich and plentiful. In that day, your livestock will feed in large pastures.
verses.ct: Then God will send rain for the seeds you plant, and the ground will produce rich, abundant food. In that day, your livestock will graze in wide-open pastures.

verses.kjv: The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall eat clean provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.
verses.web: The oxen likewise and the young donkeys that till the ground will eat savory feed, which has been winnowed with the shovel and with the fork.
verses.ct: The oxen and donkeys that work the soil will eat the finest grain, winnowed clean with shovel and fork.

verses.kjv: And there shall be upon every high mountain, and upon every high hill, rivers and streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.
verses.web: There will be brooks and streams of water on every lofty mountain and on every high hill in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.
verses.ct: On every tall mountain and every high hill, streams of water will flow on the day of the great slaughter, when the towers come crashing down.

verses.kjv: Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days, in the day that the LORD bindeth up the breach of his people, and healeth the stroke of their wound.
verses.web: Moreover the light of the moon will be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven days, in the day that LORD binds up the fracture of his people, and heals the wound they were struck with.
verses.ct: The moonlight will shine as bright as the sun, and the sunlight will be 7 times brighter — like a whole week's worth of light in a single day — when the LORD bandages his people's wounds and heals the injuries he inflicted.

verses.kjv: Behold, the name of the LORD cometh from far, burning with his anger, and the burden thereof is heavy: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue as a devouring fire:
verses.web: Behold, LORD’s name comes from far away, burning with his anger, and in thick rising smoke. His lips are full of indignation. His tongue is as a devouring fire.
verses.ct: Look! The name of the LORD comes from far away, burning with anger, heavy with fury. His lips overflow with rage, and his tongue is like a consuming fire.

verses.kjv: And his breath, as an overflowing stream, shall reach to the midst of the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of vanity: and there shall be a bridle in the jaws of the people, causing them to err.
verses.web: His breath is as an overflowing stream that reaches even to the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of destruction. A bridle that leads to ruin will be in the jaws of the peoples.
verses.ct: His breath is like a flooding river rising up to the neck. He comes to sift the nations in a sieve of destruction, and to put a bridle in the jaws of the peoples that leads them to ruin.

verses.kjv: Ye shall have a song, as in the night when a holy solemnity is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goeth with a pipe to come into the mountain of the LORD, to the mighty One of Israel.
verses.web: You will have a song, as in the night when a holy feast is kept, and gladness of heart, as when one goes with a flute to come to LORD’s mountain, to Israel’s Rock.
verses.ct: But for you there will be singing — like the joy of a night when a holy festival begins — and gladness of heart, like people marching with flutes on their way to the mountain of the LORD, to the Rock of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall cause his glorious voice to be heard, and shall shew the lighting down of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and with the flame of a devouring fire, with scattering, and tempest, and hailstones.
verses.web: LORD will cause his glorious voice to be heard, and will show the descent of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and the flame of a devouring fire, with a blast, storm, and hailstones.
verses.ct: The LORD will make his majestic voice heard and reveal the force of his arm striking down, with furious anger and consuming fire, with cloudbursts, storms, and hailstones.

verses.kjv: For through the voice of the LORD shall the Assyrian be beaten down, which smote with a rod.
verses.web: For through LORD’s voice the Assyrian will be dismayed. He will strike him with his rod.
verses.ct: The voice of the LORD will shatter Assyria — the nation that once struck others with its rod.

verses.kjv: And in every place where the grounded staff shall pass, which the LORD shall lay upon him, it shall be with tabrets and harps: and in battles of shaking will he fight with it.
verses.web: Every stroke of the rod of punishment, which LORD will lay on him, will be with the sound of tambourines and harps. He will fight with them in battles, brandishing weapons.
verses.ct: Every blow of the rod of punishment that the LORD brings down on Assyria will be accompanied by tambourines and harps, as he fights against them in battle with powerful blows.

verses.kjv: For Tophet is ordained of old; yea, for the king it is prepared; he hath made it deep and large: the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it.
verses.web: For his burning place has long been ready. Yes, for the king it is prepared. He has made its pyre deep and large with fire and much wood. LORD’s breath, like a stream of sulfur, kindles it.
verses.ct: A burning place has been prepared for a long time — yes, it's ready for the king himself. He made its pit deep and wide, with a massive pile of fire and wood. The breath of the LORD, like a stream of sulfur, sets it ablaze.
